key.name: window-width
key.description: The width of the main window in pixels.

key.name: window-height
key.description: The height of the main window in pixels.

key.name: window-is-maximized
key.summary: A flag to enable maximized mode
key.description: A flag to enable maximized mode

key.name: bookmarks
key.description: Contains all paths bookmarked by the user as an array of strings.

key.name: restore-view
key.summary: A flag to restore the last view
key.description: If “true”, Dconf Editor tries at launch to navigate to the path described in the “saved-view” key.

key.name: saved-view
key.summary: A path to restore the last view
key.description: If the “restore-view” key is set to “true”, Dconf Editor tries at launch to navigate to this path.

key.name: show-warning
key.description: If “true”, Dconf Editor opens a popup when launched reminding the user to be careful.

key.name: small-keys-list-rows
key.summary: A flag to enable small rows for keys list
key.description: If “true”, the keys list use smaller rows.

key.name: small-bookmarks-rows
key.summary: A flag to enable small rows for bookmarks list
key.description: If “true”, the bookmarks list use smaller rows.

key.name: behaviour
key.summary: Change the behaviour of a key value change request
key.description: The “unsafe” value is discouraged: for keys that have a non-special-cased type, it updates the key value each time something changes in the entry, so including intermediate states. The “safe” value asks for confirmation in these cases, but allows instant changes for booleans and nullable booleans, enums and flags. The “always-confirm-implicit” and “always-confirm-explicit” values always asks for confirmation, but the first applies the change if you change path whereas the second dismiss it. The “always-delay” value adds each change in delay mode, allowing to apply multiple keys at once.

key.name: sort-case-sensitive
key.summary: A flag to sort keys list case-sensitively
key.description: GSettings doesn’t allow keys to use upper-case in their names, but installation paths of schemas can. If “true”, the keys list is sorted case-sensitively, with in usual order upper-case folders first.

key.name: boolean
key.description: Booleans can only take two values, “true” or “false”.

key.name: boolean-nullable
key.description: GSettings allows nullable types, that are similar to other types but could take a “nothing” value. A nullable boolean can only take three values, “true”, “false” and “nothing”.

key.name: byte
key.description: A byte value is an integer between 0 and 255. It may be used to pass around characters.

key.name: bytestring
key.description: The bytestring type is commonly used to pass around strings that may not be valid utf8. In that case, the convention is that the nul terminator character should be included as the last character in the array.

key.name: bytestring-array
key.description: This is the type of an array of bytestrings. The bytestring type is commonly used to pass around strings that may not be valid utf8.

key.name: dbus-handle
key.description:
The handle type is a 32bit signed integer value that is, by convention, used as an index into an array of file descriptors that are sent alongside a D-Bus message.
If you are not interacting with D-Bus, then there is no reason to make use of this type.

key.name: dbus-object-path
key.description:
An object path is used to identify D-Bus objects at a given destination on the bus.
If you are not interacting with D-Bus, then there is no reason to make use of this type.

key.name: dbus-object-path-array
key.summary: A D-Bus object path array, type ‘ao’
key.description:
An object path array could contain any number of object paths (including none: “[]”).
If you are not interacting with D-Bus, then there is no reason to make use of this type.

key.name: dbus-signature
key.description:
A D-Bus signature is a string used as type signature for a D-Bus method or message.
If you are not interacting with D-Bus, then there is no reason to make use of this type.

key.name: double
key.description: A double value could represent any real number.

key.name: enumeration
key.description: Enumerations could be done either with the “enum” attribute, or with a “choices” tag.

key.name: integer-16-signed
key.description: A 16bit signed integer. See also the “integer-16-unsigned” key.

key.name: flags
key.description: Flags could be set by the “enum” attribute.

key.name: integer-16-unsigned
key.description: A 16bit unsigned integer. See also the “integer-16-signed” key.

key.name: integer-32-signed
key.description: A 32bit signed integer. See also the “integer-32-unsigned” key.

key.name: integer-32-unsigned
key.description: A 32bit unsigned integer. See also the “integer-32-signed” key.

key.name: integer-64-signed
key.description: A 64bit signed integer. See also the “integer-64-unsigned” key.

key.name: integer-64-unsigned
key.description: A 64bit unsigned integer. See also the “integer-64-signed” key.

key.name: number-with-range
key.description: Every numeral setting (integers and unsigned integers of every type, plus doubles) could be limited to a custom range of values. For example, this integer could only take a value between -2 and 10.

key.name: pair-of-integers
key.description: Dconf Editor lets you edit any settings type supported by GSettings, falling back on a string entry when it doesn’t have a better way to do. Here is a tuple of two 32bit signed integers.

key.name: string
key.default: 'Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.'
key.description: The string type could accept any utf8 string. Note that an empty string “''” is not the same as NULL (nothing); see also the “string-nullable” key.

key.name: string-array
key.description: A string array contains any number of strings of whatever length. It may be an empty array, “[]”.

key.name: string-nullable
key.description: GSettings allows nullable types, that are similar to other types but could take a “nothing” value. A nullable string can take any string as value, including the empty string “''”, or can be NULL (nothing).

key.name: weird-enum
key.description: An enumeration could contain only one item, but that’s probably an error. Dconf Editor warns you in that case.

key.name: weird-range
key.description: A range could limit an integer key to only allow one value, but that’s probably an error. Dconf Editor warns you in that case.
